meanings.sent1: She reestimated the cost of the project after receiving new information.
meanings.sent2: The scientist reestimated the time needed for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: After realizing she forgot to include taxes, she reestimated the total amount.
meanings.sent4: The coach reestimated the team's chances of winning after a key player got injured.
meanings.sent5: He reestimated the distance to the destination and realized he had taken a wrong turn.

meanings.definition: To make a new estimate of.
meanings.sent1: The company reestimated the budget for the upcoming year.
meanings.sent2: The meteorologist reestimated the amount of rainfall expected for the week.
meanings.sent3: The student reestimated the time it would take to finish the assignment, realizing it was longer than expected.
meanings.sent4: The architect reestimated the materials needed for the construction project.
meanings.sent5: She reestimated the number of guests attending the party and ordered more food.
